DescriptionText.Text: Hope nobody minds if we grab a few things. - %1$s
We should check out the signal that Lily discovered. Could be important. - %1$s

Objective.ObjectiveText: Search for the source of the signal.

DescriptionText.Text: I guess if they didn't want us taking this stuff, they wouldn't be broadcasting the coordinates. - %1$s
Hopefully this means some more supplies. Either way, we should check things out.
More great stuff from Cleo. Why is she sending us all this gear? - %1$s
Looks like we're getting more loot from Cleo. Hopefully she got Lily that pony she's been wanting.
Man, this is some pretty serious hardware. Who the hell is Cleo, and how is she getting ahold of this gear? - %1$s
Good timing. We could use some more supplies.
When we make it out of this, we should make Cleo some quality baked goods. Or something. What's the appropriate gift for someone that sends you guns and landmines? - %1$s
More help from our friend Cleo. We should check it out.
Wonder what she's got for us this time?
Man, this is getting to be just like Christmas. - %1$s
We'll put it to good use. - %1$s
Looks like we're getting some more equipment.
Where the hell did these nutjobs come from? And why are they so... bitey? - %1$s
Wants to get to the Ranger Station.
Made it to the ranger station, but it looks like we're not out of the woods yet. Heh. Ed will be sad he missed making that pun. - %1$s

MissionFramework.DescriptionText: Investigate the source of the gunshots.
MissionFramework.Label: ta20Gunshots

DescriptionText.Text: Well, I'm sure as hell not gonna object to having a trained soldier on our side. - %1$s

MissionFramework.DescriptionText: Check the cabins for survivors and supplies.
MissionFramework.Label: ta20Forest

DescriptionText.Text: Found some stuff that might be useful, but nobody else alive. This is so fucked up. - %1$s

MissionFramework.DescriptionText: Check the cabins for survivors and supplies.
MissionFramework.Label: ta20Lakeside

DescriptionText.Text: Jesus. This is like walking through a war zone. - %1$s

MissionFramework.DescriptionText: Climb the water tower and look around.
MissionFramework.Label: ta20Tower

DescriptionText.Text: This kind of surveying could be useful - I'll have to mark likely spots on my map. - %1$s
Holy shit! We were only gone a few minutes, what the hell happened? - %1$s

MissionFramework.DescriptionText: Mt. Tanner is fucked. It's time to leave.
MissionFramework.Label: ta40Bridge

DescriptionText.Text: Maybe they can get us out of here. -%1$s
If the Army isn't here to get us out, what the hell are they doing here? -%1$s
Sounds like the Army is stepping things up.... -%1$s
Your heroics have earned you Fame.
Close call for those two, looks like the Army isn't here to protect and serve. -%1$s
Sounds like the Army's "non-interference" policy is coming from higher up. -%1$s
Your heroics have earned you Fame.

MissionFramework.DescriptionText: Find out what's happening at the bridge.
MissionFramework.Label: ar04Bridges

DescriptionText.Text: Sounds like Sgt. Tan's having trouble with his superiors. -%1$s
Your heroics have earned you Fame.
Well, we're not stuck on this side of the river any more. Wonder what's happening over there. -%1$s
Okay, this is starting to get seriously creepy. -%1$s
Will look around for any survivors.
Sgt. Tan found something, he wants to meet and it doesn't sound good. -%1$s
Well, now we know where the black fever came from. -%1$s
Only one way out and it's walled off. Options are limited, get through it or die. -%1$s
The military has a term for this...FUBAR. -%1$s

MissionOfferChoices.AcceptDescText: START MISSION. This could get pretty intense.
MissionOfferChoices.DoNothingDescText: Delay. Sgt. Tan will wait for you.
MissionOfferChoices.OfferText: Go get the explosives?

DescriptionText.Text: We're going to need some pretty hefty firepower to blow this barricade. -%1$s
Your heroics have earned you Fame.
Oh, military-grade explosives. Is there any problem you can't solve?

MissionOfferChoices.AcceptDescText: START FINAL MISSION. Be sure all your old business is complete first.
MissionOfferChoices.DoNothingDescText: Delay. Sgt. Tan will wait around for you.
MissionOfferChoices.OfferText: Blow Up the Barrier?

DescriptionText.Text: All that's left is to blow this barricade and get out of here. -%1$s
Your heroics have earned you Fame.

Objective.ObjectiveText: Stay out of the Blast Radius

NameText.Text: MISSION: The Voice On the Radio

DescriptionText.Text: I'm not sure how much I trust these people, but at least they're not trying to kill us on sight. - %1$s
Meeting new allies has earned you Fame.

NameText.Text: COMPLETED: The Voice On the Radio

DescriptionText.Text: Well, looks like we're not evicted, yet. Keeping an eye on Alan though. -%1$s

MissionFramework.DescriptionText: Get a tour of the church.
MissionFramework.Label: ch02Tour

MissionOfferChoices.AcceptDescText: START MISSION. Get a quick tour and earn a little Trust with Lily.
MissionOfferChoices.DeclineDescText: DECLINE MISSION. Lily may still have a little something to say to you.
MissionOfferChoices.OfferText: Get a quick tour of the church?

DescriptionText.Text: Lily wants to show me around the church. I guess that's a good move. - %1$s

TutorialText.Text: Taking things from the supply locker costs Influence.

DescriptionText.Text: There's a supply locker back at home where I can load up on emergency supplies.

TutorialText.Text: Eat a snack for a temporary energy boost.

DescriptionText.Text: I'm realizing more and more that stamina is the key to survival. And the more stuff I carry, the less stamina I have.
Gotta say, it seems like these people have a pretty good setup here. Maybe we should stick around. - %1$s

TutorialText.Text: Taking things from the supply locker costs Influence.

DescriptionText.Text: There's a supply locker back at home where I can load up on emergency supplies.

TutorialText.Text: Eat a snack for a temporary energy boost.

DescriptionText.Text: I'm realizing more and more that stamina is the key to survival. And the more stuff I carry, the less stamina I have.
I skipped the tour, but Lily still had something to say: I need to score some antibiotics for Ed or he's going to die. - %1$s

MissionFramework.DescriptionText: Look for a place to find medicine.
MissionFramework.Label: ch03Survey

DescriptionText.Text: Lily wants me to go climb a cell tower in town and see if I can see any place to find medicine. - %1$s

TutorialText.Text: I'll mark survey locations on my map with BINOCULARS.

DescriptionText.Text: Rather than charging in blindly, Lily suggests using elevated survey locations to spot areas of heavy zombie activity and scope out places that are likely to have useful stuff. - %1$s

SummaryText.Text: We can scope things out in advance.

DescriptionText.Text: Spotted a vet clinic that looks fairly untouched. We're going to go see what we can find. - %1$s
Sam and Alan are waiting at the clinic. I'll put up with Alan if it means getting the meds. -%1$s
Your heroics have earned you Fame.
Note to self: punch Alan right in his goddamn face. - %1$s
Lily needs special medication or she will die.

TutorialText.Text: I should return home.

DescriptionText.Text: Met up with Sam and Alan, but things didn't go all that well. - %1$s

TutorialText.Text: I really missed an opportunity here, but life goes on.

DescriptionText.Text: Everything went to hell at the Vet Clinic. I think Alan still made it out with the medicine, but no one here's gonna trust me for a long time, I think. - %1$s
Lily's brother is in trouble. Maybe if I bail him out it'll earn us some points. -%1$s
Your heroics have earned you Fame.
I got Lily's brother home safe. Hopefully his boyfriend made it too. - %1$s
Headed off to join the other Wilkersons.
I got Lily's brother home safe. Hopefully his boyfriend made it too. - %1$s
Back at the Church. Worried about Eli.
Headed off to join the other Wilkersons. We didn't create a distraction for him.
I saw that Lily's brother was in trouble, but couldn't help. - %1$s

SummaryText.Text: Jacob was left to his fate.

DescriptionText.Text: I saw that Lily's brother was in trouble, but couldn't help. - %1$s

SummaryText.Text: Jacob was left to his fate.

DescriptionText.Text: May make it home on his own.

TutorialText.Text: Talk to Jacob to start looking for home sites.

DescriptionText.Text: Jacob's right. It might be time to start looking elsewhere.
Ready to look for home sites.
Could use some time to cool off.

MissionFramework.DescriptionText: Go scout for a larger place to call home.
MissionFramework.Label: ch05Sites

MissionOfferChoices.AcceptDescText: START MISSION. Go on a road trip with Jacob.
MissionOfferChoices.DoNothingDescText: Delay the mission.
MissionOfferChoices.OfferText: Look for home sites?

DescriptionText.Text: Things are getting pretty crowded. Might be time to start looking for a new place to stay. - %1$s
I think we've got bigger problems than overcrowding now. - %1$s
That was no disease we've ever seen before.
I think everybody's going to be sleeping with one eye open from now on. - %1$s

MissionOfferChoices.AcceptDescText: START MISSION. Hear what Alan has to say.
MissionOfferChoices.DeclineDescText: DECLINE MISSION. Who cares what this asshole says?
MissionOfferChoices.OfferText: Talk to Alan?

DescriptionText.Text: What the hell is Alan up to? - %1$s
Never would have expected that from Alan... maybe I was wrong about him. - %1$s
Doc Hanson's with the Wilkersons. From everything I've heard, these people are dangerous. - %1$s
Your heroics have earned you Fame.
Mickey and Job are in mourning for their brother Eli. Best to give them some space. - %1$s

SummaryText.Text: Doc will meet you at home later.

DescriptionText.Text: Will swing by the Church later.
I have other patients to see, but I will come visit the church and check on this friend of yours soon as I can. - %1$s

MissionOfferChoices.AcceptDescText: START MISSION. The Wilkersons probably won't take kindly to your questions.
MissionOfferChoices.AcceptText: I have some questions for you.
MissionOfferChoices.DeclineDescText: DECLINE MISSION. Are you willing to turn a blind eye to what's happening?
MissionOfferChoices.DeclineText: Never mind. I'm just here to trade.
MissionOfferChoices.DoNothingDescText: Delay your decision.
MissionOfferChoices.OfferText: Was there something else?

DescriptionText.Text: Somebody's been attacking survivors, stealing their stuff, and generally being assholes. Time to talk to the Wilkersons. - %1$s
Lily says to talk with him, not Mickey.
Decided not to question the Wilkersons about whether or not they've been robbing people. - %1$s
Job says he doesn't know anything about raids. Yeah, right. - %1$s
Job says he doesn't know anything about raids. Yeah, right. - %1$s

MissionOfferChoices.AcceptDescText: START MISSION. Seems like a harmless way to earn a little goodwill.
MissionOfferChoices.DeclineDescText: DECLINE MISSION. This is not how you make friends.
MissionOfferChoices.DeclineText: I won't be a part of this.
MissionOfferChoices.DoNothingDescText: Delay your decision. They may find another ride for him in the meantime.
MissionOfferChoices.OfferText: Give the man a ride?

DescriptionText.Text: Mickey Wilkerson's got a "job" for interested takers. I'm not sure I want to know. - %1$s
I'm not playing errand boy for the Wilkersons. - %1$s
So, Mickey beats the shit out of a guy, then has him escorted home? Weird. - %1$s
Took a beating for late payments to the Wilkersons.

MissionOfferChoices.AcceptDescText: START MISSION. Give up 5 Cases of Ammo to help a stranger.
MissionOfferChoices.DeclineDescText: DECLINE MISSION. Leave the stranger to fend for himself.
MissionOfferChoices.DoNothingDescText: Delay your decision. What could possibly happen in the meantime?
MissionOfferChoices.OfferText: Pay the stranger's debt?

DescriptionText.Text: Note to self: deals with Job Wilkerson are bad news. - %1$s

SummaryText.Text: Find out what spooked the poor guy.

DescriptionText.Text: Owes the Wilkersons some AMMO. Doesn't have it.
Met a man in debt to the Wilkersons. I thought about helping, but we can't spare the ammo. - %1$s
I wanted to help the stranger out, but we don't have what he needs. - %1$s

Console_Command.Command: LOG: Trade Mission - Aborting; Not Enough Resources
LOG: Trade Mission - Spending Resources For Mission

DescriptionText.Text: Nobody deserves to be in debt to the Wilkersons. - %1$s
Would be dead without our help.

MissionFramework.DescriptionText: Find out what the Wilkersons want.
MissionFramework.Label: wi03Pitch

MissionOfferChoices.AcceptDescText: ADD MISSION. Earn a little more goodwill with the Wilkersons.
MissionOfferChoices.DeclineDescText: DECLINE MISSION. Piss off the Wilkersons but avoid any more entanglements.
MissionOfferChoices.DoNothingDescText: Delay your decision. They might be willing to wait a while.
MissionOfferChoices.OfferText: Broker the Exchange?

DescriptionText.Text: One of the Wilkersons' gun thugs is waiting to talk to me. - %1$s
Might have been a foolish move, but I turned down an offer from the Wilkersons. At least Lily'll be proud of me. - %1$s

MissionFramework.Label: wi03Exchange
MissionFramework.SetupFlags: NpcsAtStart, StartPosInBuilding, ApproachReqInBuilding, ApproachReqNpcLos, GreetOnApproach, HideOpDuringMission

MissionOfferChoices.AcceptDescText: START MISSION. Do what you said you were going to do.
MissionOfferChoices.DeclineDescText: DECLINE MISSION. Try to talk them out of meeting with the Wilkersons.
MissionOfferChoices.DoNothingDescText: Delay your decision.
MissionOfferChoices.OfferText: Ready to get going?

DescriptionText.Text: Mickey and Job have some kind of deal going down, and they want me as a neutral observer. - %1$s
Wants an escort to the exchange site.
Business as usual for the Wilkersons. -%1$s
Suspecting something isn't quite right, you decide not to take the survivors to meet the Wilkersons.

SummaryText.Text: Something is not quite right here.

DescriptionText.Text: Sounds like there's some vestige of civilization hanging on at the courthouse in Marshall. - %1$s
Claims to have things under control.

MissionOfferChoices.AcceptDescText: START MISSION. It might be useful to earn the respect of the local Sheriff.
MissionOfferChoices.DeclineDescText: DECLINE MISSION. Do they really expect you to risk your neck for them?
MissionOfferChoices.DoNothingDescText: Delay your decision.
MissionOfferChoices.OfferText: Help the Sheriff out?

DescriptionText.Text: The Sheriff wants some help clearing infestations. Guess I've been deputized. - %1$s

SummaryText.Text: Clear the infestations with Sheriff Carl.

DescriptionText.Text: The Sheriff in Marshall asked me for some help, and I refused. I wonder if that was a mistake. - %1$s
Your heroics have earned you Fame.
Cleared some infestations but Marshall's Police are barely hanging on. -%1$s
I was contacted by a local bigshot, he wants to meet in Marshall. -%1$s
Ray shared his philosophy with me. Seems like a decent enough guy. - %1$s
Might be a good friend to have. Might be full of shit.
Ray says he's got something for me. Wonder what it is. - %1$s
Ray Santos tried to bribe me with a car. Screw him. - %1$s

SummaryText.Text: No more free cars for me.

TutorialText.Text: Press [ul_radio_menu] to use the radio.

DescriptionText.Text: Collecting cars appear to be one of Santos' big interests. If we stay on his good side, it looks like he can provide working vehicles for us. - %1$s

SummaryText.Text: Ray says he can get us cars when we need 'em.

TutorialText.Text: We'll hear more from him later, I'm sure.

MissionOfferChoices.AcceptDescText: START MISSION. Earn 3 Cases of Ammo with a simple (?) delivery mission.
MissionOfferChoices.DeclineDescText: DECLINE MISSION. Skip out this.
MissionOfferChoices.DoNothingDescText: Delay your decision.
MissionOfferChoices.OfferText: I need someone to make a delivery.

DescriptionText.Text: That guy's a little too slick for me. I'm not interested in getting tangled up with him. - %1$s

SummaryText.Text: Passed on a job from Ray Santos.

DescriptionText.Text: We've been asked to help Ray out with some deliveries. He says he'll make it worth our while. - %1$s
Signed, sealed, and delivered. Now we'll see if Ray comes through with payment. - %1$s
Signed, sealed, and delivered. Now we'll see if Ray comes through with payment. - %1$s
Something doesn't feel right about this one.... - %1$s
Without our help, there's no way anyone survived. - %1$s
Your heroics have earned you Fame.
Jesus, what a waste. Marshall may be lost. -%1$s

SummaryText.Text: The Judge and the Sheriff are dead.

TutorialText.Text: After one died, the others ran away. - %2$s

DescriptionText.Text: Without our help, there's no way anyone survived. - %1$s

MissionOfferChoices.AcceptDescText: START MISSION. There probably isn't much in it for you other than earning some goodwill.
MissionOfferChoices.DeclineDescText: DECLINE MISSION. Tell the strangers to fend for themselves. This isn't how we make friends.
MissionOfferChoices.DoNothingDescText: Delay your decision. Quentin won't hang around waiting forever.
MissionOfferChoices.OfferText: Help find missing friend?

DescriptionText.Text: Sounds like somebody lost one of their people. - %1$s
Trying to find someone named Jack.
Ran into some people who really needed my help to find their friend Jack. Whatever. I don't know Jack. - %1$s
Met some folks holed up in the grange outside Marshall. Decent folks, just hanging on. -%1$s
Was ready to abandon the search.

MissionOfferChoices.AcceptDescText: START MISSION. Another potential act of charity.
MissionOfferChoices.DeclineDescText: DECLINE MISSION. Nobody'll blame you for not helping. (Except the people at the Grange.)
MissionOfferChoices.DoNothingDescText: Delay your decision. Becca won't wait forever before trying it without you, though.
MissionOfferChoices.OfferText: Help us set up defenses?

DescriptionText.Text: Sounds like the folks at the grange could use some help with their defenses. - %1$s
Has always offered to help you.
The folks at the Grange needed my help. Sucks to be them. - %1$s

SummaryText.Text: The Grange survivors are kinda pissed.

DescriptionText.Text: The folks at the Grange needed more help than I could give them. - %1$s

SummaryText.Text: The Grange survivors are kinda pissed.

DescriptionText.Text: Your heroics have earned you Fame.
That should last Becca a while. Also: TMI. Seriously. - %1$s
Apparently, I didn't pull my weight. - %1$s

MissionOfferChoices.AcceptDescText: ADD MISSION. You'll gain a little Trust with Quentin, no doubt.
MissionOfferChoices.DeclineDescText: DECLINE MISSION. Quentin probably won't appreciate that.
MissionOfferChoices.DoNothingDescText: Delay your decision. Quentin probably won't wait forever.
MissionOfferChoices.OfferText: Investigate Becca's Background?

DescriptionText.Text: Quentin wanted me to snoop into Becca/Alex's background. I didn't think it was a good idea. - %1$s

SummaryText.Text: Some questions are better left unasked.

DescriptionText.Text: Quentin wants me to find out about Becca's past. Sheriff Parsons seemed to know something; maybe I should start with him. - %1$s

MissionOfferChoices.AcceptDescText: ADD MISSION. Find out where Carl is.
MissionOfferChoices.DoNothingDescText: Wait until later to ask.
MissionOfferChoices.OfferText: Ask about Carl?

DescriptionText.Text: Huh. No wonder Becca wanted to keep her past hidden. - %1$s
Best place to start is probably the Courthouse. - %1$s

MissionOfferChoices.AcceptDescText: Tell Quentin everything you heard.
MissionOfferChoices.DeclineDescText: Advise him to let the past go.
MissionOfferChoices.OfferText: Tell Quentin what you learned?

DescriptionText.Text: Guess I've got to decide what to tell Quentin. - %1$s
I advised Quentin to let the whole "Alex" thing drop. We've all gotta learn to leave the past behind us. - %1$s

SummaryText.Text: Some questions are better left unasked.

DescriptionText.Text: Will need to talk to Becca directly.
Well, we'll see how Qentin deals with it now.... - %1$s
Well, I guess I better go find him. - %1$s
Jesus... like we don't have enough trouble with the walking dead? - %1$s
I made it to the Ranger Station, and I'm starting to wonder if this was a good idea. It looks like things have gotten worse since last time anyone came here.

SummaryText.Text: Things have gone from bad to worse up here.

DescriptionText.Text: I can't believe it. Lily's dad was actually wearing that watch that she gave him as a kid. Maybe this trip to the Ranger Station was worth it after all.

SummaryText.Text: I found that watch Lily was talking about ...

MissionFramework.DescriptionText: Come help him out before it's too late.
MissionFramework.Label: bagDoc

TutorialText.Text: Look for the "Medical Advice" option in your radio.

DescriptionText.Text: Got Doc Hanson out of a jam at the cemetery. He's offered to provide medical advice to me and my friends. - %1$s
Better go help Doc Hanson, we can't afford to lose his expertise. -%1$s
Doc Hanson ran into trouble. I wasn't able to help. - %1$s

MissionFramework.DescriptionText: See what Sam's been up to.
MissionFramework.Label: bagSam
MissionFramework.TestCommand: rts_test initmissiontest; rts_set Game.StoryCH.MedsAcquired 1; cm_addmission bagSam

MissionOfferChoices.AcceptDescText: START MISSION. She plays it cool, but Sam would probably appreciate the help.
MissionOfferChoices.DeclineDescText: DECLINE MISSION. Sam isn't the type to hold a grudge, is she?
MissionOfferChoices.DoNothingDescText: Delay your decision. Sam won't wait around forever.
MissionOfferChoices.OfferText: Help Sam find Andy Pimms?

DescriptionText.Text: Never would have figured Sam had such a soft side. -%1$s
That's pretty much how I expected this to end. Still sucks. -%1$s

MissionFramework.DescriptionText: The supply run will complete on its own. Or you could provide an escort.
MissionFramework.Label: SupplyRunBasic

MissionOfferChoices.AcceptDescText: START MISSION. Provide an escort for the supply run.
MissionOfferChoices.DoNothingDescText: The supply run can be completed without you.
MissionOfferChoices.OfferText: I could use help getting this stuff home.

DescriptionText.Text: %3$s can probably handle it solo, but I could provide an escort if I wanted. - %1$s
Helped %3$s on a supply run. Provided a safe escort home. - %1$s
%1$s was out gathering supplies for the community. I offered to provide an escort home, but things went to shit. I failed. - %2$s

Objective.ObjectiveText: Lead the Runners Back to Base

%1$s radioed home to report trouble with some zombies. I headed over to help out, but couldn't get it done. - %2$s

DescriptionText.Text: Other survivors are having problems with zombie infestations. We should consider helping them out. -%2$s
Ready to take out an Infestation.
That should thin the zombies out for a while. Makes things safer for all of us. -%1$s
I turned down a mission. Maybe I could have been more tactful. - %1$s

SummaryText.Text: This isn't how we make friends.

DescriptionText.Text: After one died, the others ran away. - %2$s
%1$s took care of that infestation without us. Go team! - %2$s
Much as I'd love it if we could claim credit for wiping out that infestation, it sounds like that was all %1$s. - %2$s
Well, that's one less infestation for us to worry about. Remind me to send %1$s a fruit basket. - %2$s
Look like that infestation was worse than we thought. %1$s couldn't even make a dent. - %2$s
%1$s didn't have enough support to clear out that infestation. - %2$s
Well, that was a total disaster. %1$s and the team got their butts kicked by that infestation. - %2$s
Clearing infestations is rough work. Just ask %1$s. - %2$s
Well, the infestation's dealt with, but %1$s had a pretty nasty time of it. - %2$s
Sounds like clearing out that infestation got pretty hairy. %1$s barely made it out with the team. - %2$s
Even in defeat, we can fight back. %1$s understood that. - %2$s
%1$s will be remembered as a hero. Without this sacrifice we would not have triumphed. - %2$s

MissionOfferChoices.AcceptDescText: START MISSION. Earn Trust for helping clear the infestation.
MissionOfferChoices.DeclineDescText: DECLINE MISSION. Let them handle their own problems.
MissionOfferChoices.DoNothingDescText: Delay your decision. They probably won't wait forever.
MissionOfferChoices.OfferText: We need help clearing out an infestation!

DescriptionText.Text: %2$s is stuck in the middle of an infestation. Without help, I don't like the odds. -%2$s
Ready to take out an Infestation.
We got %3$s out of there. Could have gone a lot worse. -%1$s
%1$s took care of that infestation without us. Go team! - %2$s
Much as I'd love it if we could claim credit for wiping out that infestation, it sounds like that was all %1$s. - %2$s
Well, that's one less infestation for us to worry about. Remind me to send %1$s a fruit basket. - %2$s
Look like that infestation was worse than we thought. %1$s couldn't even make a dent. - %2$s
%1$s didn't have enough support to clear out that infestation. - %2$s
Well, that was a total disaster. %1$s and the team got their butts kicked by that infestation. - %2$s
Clearing infestations is rough work. Just ask %1$s. - %2$s
Well, the infestation's dealt with, but %1$s had a pretty nasty time of it. - %2$s
Sounds like clearing out that infestation got pretty hairy. %1$s barely made it out with the team. - %2$s
Even in defeat, we can fight back. %1$s understood that. - %2$s
%1$s will be remembered as a hero. Without this sacrifice we would not have triumphed. - %2$s
I turned down a mission. Maybe I could have been more tactful. - %1$s

SummaryText.Text: This isn't how we make friends.

MissionFramework.SetupFlags: NpcsAtStart, DontAutoWaypointOnAdd, ApproachReqInBuilding, ApproachReqNpcLos, GreetOnApproach, RelocateOnHomeMoved

MissionOfferChoices.AcceptDescText: RECRUIT SURVIVORS. Escort this entire group home to join your community.
MissionOfferChoices.DeclineDescText: REFUSE SURVIVORS. Let them know they're on their own.
MissionOfferChoices.DeclineText: I have no use for you.
MissionOfferChoices.DoNothingDescText: Delay your decision. Maybe they'll survive long enough for you to reconsider.
MissionOfferChoices.DoNothingText: That's nice of you to say...
MissionOfferChoices.OfferText: You really know what you're doing.

DescriptionText.Text: A group of survivors is interested in joining our community. - %2$s
I refused a group who wanted to join us. I do not think they will forgive us soon. - %1$s

SummaryText.Text: This isn't how we make friends.

DescriptionText.Text: Your heroics have earned you Fame.
Some new survivors have thrown their lot in with us. -%1$s
Even in defeat, we can fight back. %1$s understood that. - %2$s
I will be forever grateful. Without %1$s's sacrifice, I would not be here today. - %2$s

MissionFramework.SetupFlags: DontAutoWaypointOnAdd, NpcsAtStart, TargetPosInBuildingNear, ApproachReqInBuilding, ApproachReqNpcLos, GreetOnApproach

MissionOfferChoices.AcceptDescText: START MISSION. An act of kindness. There probably isn't much reward in this for you.
MissionOfferChoices.DeclineDescText: DECLINE MISSION. Let them know the futility of their actions.
MissionOfferChoices.DoNothingDescText: Delay your decision.
MissionOfferChoices.OfferText: I can't find my friend.

DescriptionText.Text: We're getting reports that %3$s is way overdue. Might want to look into it. -%2$s
I managed to find %3$s and get them home safe and sound.
Even in defeat, we can fight back. %1$s understood that. - %2$s
I will be forever grateful. Without %1$s's sacrifice, I would not be here today. - %2$s
After one died, the others ran away. - %2$s
Good news! %1$s found %3$s, and everybody made it home safe and sound. - %2$s
Well, you can cancel that missing persons report. %3$s just made it home, courtesy of %1$s. - %2$s
%3$s must have an angel on their shoulder, because%1$s found them and got them home. - %2$s
Still no word from %3$s. %1$s really could have used a hand out there. - %2$s
The search party couldn't even find %3$s. All in all, could have gone a lot better. - %2$s
No dice on the search for %3$s. Sounds like things got pretty hairy out there. - %2$s
Well, %3$s made it home. %1$s found 'em, but things could have gone better. - %2$s
Ready for some good news/bad news? Good news: %3$s is back home. Bad news: the search party ran into some trouble. - %2$s
%1$s could have used a hand, but at least the search party got %3$s home. - %2$s
I turned down a mission. Maybe I could have been more tactful. - %1$s

Just got a call from %1$s's people. They got home, but without our backup, it went pretty bad. - %2$s
Sounds like %1$s' people aren't too happy with us. I guess %1$s really needed that escort home. - %2$s
%1$s's people are still searching, but it's not looking good. - %2$s
I don't think %1$s is going to make it home. Guess they just couldn't hold out any longer. - %2$s
No sign of %1$s. Sounds like things got pretty hairy out there. - %2$s

MissionFramework.Label: encSiege
MissionFramework.SetupFlags: NpcsAtStart, ZombiesAtStart, DontAutoWaypointOnAdd, ApproachReqInBuilding, ApproachReqNpcLos, GreetOnApproach, RelocateOnHomeMoved

MissionOfferChoices.AcceptDescText: START MISSION. Help defend the survivors.
MissionOfferChoices.DoNothingDescText: Delay your decision. They might survive for a bit, right?
MissionOfferChoices.DoNothingText: I don't have time for this.
MissionOfferChoices.OfferText: Dammit. We can't keep the bastards out.

DescriptionText.Text: The radio calls sound pretty urgent. I don't think there's any way they're getting out of there without help. -%2$s
Hope we don't see another attack like that any time soon. -%1$s

TutorialText.Text: After one died, the others ran away. - %2$s

DescriptionText.Text: Woohoo! %1$s and some other folks fought off that siege. - %2$s
Good news--%1$s and their crew broke the siege. - %2$s
Got an update on that siege for you--%1$s took care of it. - %2$s
That was a pretty bad attack, but %1$s managed to fight them off. - %2$s
%1$s really could have used your help with that attack. They took care of it, but it was a close call. - %2$s
%1$s and Co. barely made it though that last attack. - %2$s
I've got some really bad news about %1$s and that last attack... - Lily
%1$s tried to fight off that attack themselves. It... didn't go well. - %2$s
That last attack... well... look, you need to know about %1$s.

MissionFramework.DescriptionText: Investigate the signs of survivor activity.
MissionFramework.Label: encSupplies

MissionOfferChoices.AcceptDescText: START MISSION. You'll be given half the goods after you provide an escort.
MissionOfferChoices.DeclineDescText: DECLINE MISSION. It's a cold-hearted move, but once these resources are gone, they're gone for good.
MissionOfferChoices.DeclineText: Get out of here! This stuff is mine.
MissionOfferChoices.DoNothingDescText: Delay your decision.
MissionOfferChoices.OfferText: I could use help getting this stuff home.

DescriptionText.Text: Sounds like someone's been scavenging around here. We should look into it. -%2$s
Helped some folks with a supply run. -%1$s

Came across someone gathering supplies, and we agreed to work together. %1$s would carry the supplies; I'd provide protection. I don't know what to say. I couldn't hold up my end of the bargain. - %2$s
Word on the wireless is %1$s made it home with those supplies. Seemed kinda miffed about not getting any help, though. - %2$s
The supplies made it home safe, but %1$s isn't too happy about having to do it alone. - %2$s
You can scratch that supply run out of your day planner... and expect some harsh words from %1$s. Something about being hung out to dry? - %2$s
%1$s got home with the supplies, but it was a close call. - %2$s
%1$s ran into some trouble, but at least they got the supplies home. - %2$s
%1$s ran into some trouble on the way home from a scavenging run. Probably could have used our help. - %2$s.
%1$s's supply run shouldn't have taken this long. Their people are freaking out. - %2$s
%1$s got attacked on that supply run. Tried to fight them off, but without backup.... - %2$s
Nobody's been able to raise %1$s on the radio. Supply runs shouldn't take this long... right? - %2$s.
I turned down a mission. Maybe I could have been more tactful. - %1$s

SummaryText.Text: This isn't how we make friends.

MissionFramework.DescriptionText: Trade 1 Case of Ammunition for 5 Daily Rations of Food.
MissionFramework.Label: encTradeAmmoForFood

MissionOfferChoices.AcceptDescText: START MISSION. Trade 1 Case of Ammunition for 5 Daily Rations of Food.
MissionOfferChoices.DeclineDescText: DECLINE MISSION. Prevent the trade from happening. This'll cost you some Influence.
MissionOfferChoices.DoNothingDescText: Delay your decision. The trade might happen without you.
MissionOfferChoices.OfferText: Trade our Ammo for some Food?

DescriptionText.Text: Is loaded up and ready to go.
We've gotten word that another group of survivors wants to trade some of their Food for some of our Ammunition. -%2$s

SummaryText.Text: 1 Case of Ammunition for 5 Daily Rations of Food.

DescriptionText.Text: We had a trade set up with another group of survivors, but we realize that we don't actually have our end of the deal. - %1$s

Console_Command.Command: LOG: Trade Mission - Aborting; Not Enough Resources
LOG: Trade Mission - Spending Resources For Mission

DescriptionText.Text: Attempted a trade run for an exchange with %2$s. I was providing escort. %1$s was carrying the goods. Things did not work out.
Okay, so, guess you didn't think that was worthwhile. Fair enough. - %1$s
Well, so much for that trade op. I'll let you know if I hear about any more. - %1$s
%1$s called in - said the guy who was willing to trade with us backed out. Guess we shoulda been a little quicker on the draw, - %2$s
Hey, I told you I saw an opportunity, so I took it. Just... expected it to go a little better, is all. - %1$s
Hey, we don't have time to wait around on you all the time. I took initiative. How was I supposed to know it'd go to shit? - %1$s
%1$s tried to make that trade on their own. Guess it didn't go so well, though. - %2$s
So... %1$s decided to try and make that trade run on their own, and I haven't heard from them since. I'm getting worried. - %2$s
Has anybody seen %1$s? They haven't checked in since they headed out on that trade run... oops. I wasn't supposed to mention that. - %2$s
I tried to tell %1$s not to go for that trade mission, but would they listen? - %2$s
I turned down a mission. Maybe I could have been more tactful. - %1$s

MissionFramework.DescriptionText: Investigate the signs of survivor activity.
MissionFramework.Label: comRecover

MissionOfferChoices.AcceptDescText: START MISSION. Try to find a lost community member.
MissionOfferChoices.AcceptText: Of course. I'll help you look.
MissionOfferChoices.DeclineDescText: DECLINE MISSION. Let them know the futility of their actions.
MissionOfferChoices.DoNothingDescText: Delay your decision.
MissionOfferChoices.OfferText: We're missing someone! Help me search!

DescriptionText.Text: We've had a sighting of one of our missing persons. We might have a line on %1$s's whereabouts.
We're getting reports that %3$s is way overdue. Might want to look into it. -%2$s
I managed to find %3$s and get them home safe and sound.
Good news! %1$s found %3$s, and everybody made it home safe and sound. - %2$s
Well, you can cancel that missing persons report. %3$s just made it home, courtesy of %1$s. - %2$s
%3$s must have an angel on their shoulder, because%1$s found them and got them home. - %2$s
Still no word from %3$s. %1$s really could have used a hand out there. - %2$s
The search party couldn't even find %3$s. All in all, could have gone a lot better. - %2$s
No dice on the search for %3$s. Sounds like things got pretty hairy out there. - %2$s
Well, %3$s made it home. %1$s found 'em, but things could have gone better. - %2$s
Ready for some good news/bad news? Good news: %3$s is back home. Bad news: the search party ran into some trouble. - %2$s
%1$s could have used a hand, but at least the search party got %3$s home. - %2$s
